result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph David Fortuna was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $265.60 fine/costs to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office in a payment plan of $50.00 per month beginning 11/1/2016, and due on the first of each month thereafter until paid in full.

$200.00 DNA surcharge to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office and is included in the payment plan of $50.00 per month beginning 11/1/2016, and due on the first of each month thereafter until paid in full.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph David Fortuna

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: CASES: 15CM401 & 15TR2360. Defendant Joseph David Fortuna in court with attorney James H Krave.   ADA Dan Tolan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   NE-Clerk 10:28 am.  Atty. Krave resolution, plea out para and admit to open intox., and pay fees and costs. JFortuna S&T.  CT DEF FVIK enters plea and accepts DEF plea of G.  ADA joint recommendation of costs and fine only.  Atty. Krave agrees.  CT accepts joint recommend $265.60 and $200.00 DNA surcharge. CT finds G on 15TR2360 - fine/costs of $263.50.  CT pp of $50.00 due on 11-01-16 and each month thereafter to COCC. PCR. 10:34 adj.
Motion hearing on September 23, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Final pre-trial on September 23, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Joseph David Fortuna in court with attorney James H Krave.  Daniel Joseph Tolan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CASES: 15CM401/15TR2360. JB-clerk 10:53am  No resolution. Atty Krave asking for FPT. CT-JA to set for trial w/analyst, sets FPT, bond cont. adj 10:56am  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 23, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Final pre-trial on June 3, 2016 at 10:00 am.
